definition: to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: He shall also burn the fat of the sin offering on the altar.
sentences.chinese: 贖罪祭牲的脂油要在壇上焚燒。

sentences.english: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering； and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的頭上，燔祭便蒙悅納，爲他贖罪。

sentences.english: He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 把公羊羔宰於聖地，就是宰贖罪祭牲和燔祭牲之地。

sentences.english: He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 把公羊羔宰於聖地，就是宰贖罪祭牲和燔祭牲之地。

sentences.english: He is to lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it will be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.
sentences.chinese: 他要按手在燔祭牲的頭上，燔祭便蒙悅納，爲他贖罪。

sentences.english: "The fat of my festival offerings must not be kept until morning.
sentences.chinese: 也不可將我節上祭牲的脂油留到早晨。

sentences.english: And he shall flay the burnt offering， and cut it into his pieces.
sentences.chinese: 那人要剝去燔祭牲的皮，把燔祭牲切成塊子。

sentences.english: And he shall flay the burnt offering， and cut it into his pieces.
sentences.chinese: 那人要剝去燔祭牲的皮，把燔祭牲切成塊子。

sentences.english: He is to skin the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 那人要剝去燔祭牲的皮，把燔祭牲切成塊子。

sentences.english: He is to skin the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 那人要剝去燔祭牲的皮，把燔祭牲切成塊子。

sentences.english: Then he shall skin the victim and quarter it.
sentences.chinese: 奉獻者剝去祭牲的皮，將犧牲切成塊。

sentences.english: And when they have flayed the victim, they shall cut the joints into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 奉獻者剝去祭牲的皮，將犧牲切成塊。

sentences.english: It is thought to have been the place where the blood and the washings from the Temple drained.
sentences.chinese: 一般認爲這是聖殿裏祭牲的血和污水流出的地方。

definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
Book of Leviticus/Third Book of Moses
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
